level.text: When used in this chapter, the following terms and phrases shall have the following meanings:
Case management services – Those services that assist an eligible individual in accessing needed medical, social, educational, and other services appropriate to the needs of the individual.
CFSA – the District of Columbia Child and Family Services Agency.
Client – a person who is eligible for TCM services.
Medical Assistance Administration (MAA) – the Single State Agency, within the Department of Health, responsible for administering the District of Columbia Medicaid Program.
Provider – The District of Columbia Child and Family Services Agency (CFSA) and its subcontractors.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Emergency Rulemaking published at 47 DCR 5257 (June 23, 2000) [EXPIRED]; as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 47 DCR 7084 (September 1, 2000).
